workflow.name: Evaluation metric example: RAG document relevance
workflow.description:
## AI evaluation in n8n

This is a template for n8n's [evaluation feature](https://docs.n8n.io/advanced-ai/evaluations/overview). 

Evaluation is a technique for getting confidence that your AI workflow performs reliably, by running a test dataset containing different inputs through the workflow.

By calculating a metric (score) for each input, you can see where the workflow is performing well and where it isn't.

## How it works

This template shows how to calculate a workflow evaluation metric: **retrieved document relevance** (i.e. whether the information retrieved from a vector store is relevant to the question).

The workflow takes a question and checks whether the information retrieved to answer it is relevant.

To run this workflow, you need to insert documents into a vector data store, so that they can be retrieved by the agent to answer questions. You can do this by running the top part of the workflow once.

The main workflow works as follows:

- We use an evaluation trigger to read in our dataset 
- It is wired up in parallel with the regular trigger so that the workflow can be started from either one. [More info](https://docs.n8n.io/advanced-ai/evaluations/tips-and-common-issues/#combining-multiple-triggers)
- We make sure that the agent outputs the list data from the tools that it used
- If we‚Äôre evaluating (i.e. the execution started from the evaluation trigger), we calculate the relevance metric using AI to compare the retrieved documents with the question
- We pass this information back to n8n as a metric
- If we‚Äôre not evaluating we avoid calculating the metric, to reduce cost

parameters.content: Check whether the documents returned a relevant to the question

## How it works
This template shows how to calculate a workflow evaluation metric: **retrieved document relevance** (i.e. whether the information retrieved from the vector store is relevant to the question).

The workflow takes a question and checks whether the information retrieved to answer it is relevant.

You can find more information on workflow evaluation [here](https://docs.n8n.io/advanced-ai/evaluations/overview), and other metric examples [here](https://docs.n8n.io/advanced-ai/evaluations/metric-based-evaluations/#2-calculate-metrics).
Only calculate metrics if we're evaluating, to reduce costs

### Setup: Populate vector DB
Run this once before running the main workflow. It inserts the documents from the dataset in the vector store, so they can be queried by the agent below

values.content:
=You are a teacher evaluating the relevance of student responses to questions.

You will be given a QUESTION and one or more FACTS provided by a student. Your task is to determine whether these FACTS are relevant to answering the QUESTION.

Grading criteria:
(1) Evaluate whether the provided FACTS contain information that is relevant to answering the QUESTION
(2) A FACT is relevant if it contains keywords or concepts semantically related to the QUESTION
(3) A FACT is relevant if it provides context, examples, or explanations that address any aspect of the QUESTION
(4) A FACT may contain some unrelated information and still be considered relevant if it also contains information that satisfies criteria (2) or (3)

Scoring:
- Score 1: At least one of the provided FACTS is relevant to the QUESTION
- Score 0: All provided FACTS are completely unrelated to the QUESTION

Evaluation process:
1. Identify the key concepts and requirements in the QUESTION
2. Examine each provided FACT for keywords or concepts related to these key elements
3. Consider semantic relationships, not just exact keyword matches
4. Determine if any FACT contributes useful information toward answering the QUESTION
5. Provide your reasoning in a detailed, step-by-step manner first
6. Then create a one-sentence summary of your reasoning
7. Avoid stating your conclusion at the beginning of your extended reasoning

Output format:
{
  "extended_reasoning": "<detailed step-by-step analysis of how you evaluated the relevance>",
  "reasoning_summary": "<one sentence summary of your conclusion>",
  "score": <number: either 0 or 1>
}

Examples:

QUESTION: "What factors contributed to the fall of the Roman Empire?"
FACTS: "The Roman Empire fell due to economic problems, military failures, and political corruption. Germanic tribes invaded from the north while the empire was weakened."
EVALUATION: This would receive a score of 1 because the facts directly address causes of the Roman Empire's fall.

QUESTION: "What factors contributed to the fall of the Roman Empire?"
FACTS: "The Pythagorean theorem states that a¬≤ + b¬≤ = c¬≤ in a right triangle. Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system."
EVALUATION: This would receive a score of 0 because neither fact relates to the Roman Empire or its fall.

options.systemMessage: You are a helpful assistant. Answer the user's questions using information from your vector knowledge base only.

parameters.toolDescription: Source of all knowledge to work with

parameters.content: Make sure to enable 'Return intermediate steps' in the agent, to get the list of executed tools
